Tonight, I asked what possible reason there could be for allowing witnesses in a judicial impeachment trial and allowing none for the President’s trial. There is none.

I was on the committee for the last impeachment trial in the Senate. During that time we heard from 26 witnesses, 17 of whom didn’t testify in the House, and we ultimately removed Judge Thomas Porteous.

The letters I read tonight are just a small window into the fears of millions of Americans if the Affordable Care Act is eliminated. 

This isn't about politics, this is about people. And I will fight on their behalf to the very end.
In 2015, Jen donated a kidney to a stranger. Without the Affordable Care Act’s protections, she would have a pre-existing condition that could cause her to be denied or charged more for coverage.
As an educator, Elizabeth has seen the importance of the mental health coverage guaranteed by the Affordable Care Act. If the Affordable Care Act is eradicated, she worries about her students.
Jeffrey takes medication every 24-hours to stop the advance of his MS. He says that the Affordable Care Act has “allowed me to remain a productive wage earner for me and my family.”

Noel was able to recover from a chronic illness while staying on her parents’ health care plan. She’s worried that she’ll be punished for her pre-existing condition when she gets her own health care plan if the ACA is repealed.
Mike says, “My wife and I are uninsurable without the ACA.”
At 29, Chris was diagnosed with an aggressive form of cancer. Before the ACA, he wasn’t able to purchase health care insurance. If the ACA is repealed his family worries his life will be shortened.
Debbie is self-employed and runs two businesses. She says, “If the ACA is repealed and there is no marketplace for me to purchase insurance, I will be forced to close my businesses.”

Kathy needed 24-hour infusions for 5½ days during each round of chemotherapy during her battle with cancer. She writes, “Now that the ACA is up in the air, I feel like I’m fighting for my life again!”
Kate calls her son, "the baby that almost didn’t happen" after battling cancer. She wrote, "Because of the ACA, I faced a future of hope."
Because of the Affordable Care Act, Delaney is able to get mammogram screenings to see if she carries the same genetic trait that several of her relatives have.

The Trump Administration supports totally undoing the Affordable Care Act.

As I said today, the Constitution doesn’t say, ‘We the ruling party.’ It says ‘We the people.’ If the people of this country want a check & balance & a fair process, we need to speak out. Today we did and I thank Sen. Flake for joining our call to reopen the FBI background check

Flake just said he wants a week delay of floor vote for a limited investigation.  We have been out negotiating for past hour with Chris Coons and others. Due diligence.  It is what I asked for in my remarks.

I was on @CBSThisMorning to talk about Dr. Ford’s powerful testimony and the need to reopen the FBI background check.  My colleagues can defiantly beat their chests all they want—I believe we need the facts. https://t.co/MeywBuXoTK

Question: Why wouldn’t they ask the FBI to followup with key witnesses for one week?  Answer: Because they don’t want to hear what they might say.....The Senate can’t vote on Kavanaugh now https://t.co/yweDuzftxF
The chairman just thanked Dr. Ford for her bravery in coming forward....

If the White House would have allowed FBI background check to be reopened & an investigation like in other cases, they wouldn’t have been surprised by answer to: Why did you take the polygraph test in a hotel room in Maryland? Her answer? Because I was at my grandma’s funeral.

I got the polygraph test Dr. Ford took showing truthfulness about her account in the record. To quote a judge: “law enforcement agencies use polygraphs to test the credibility of witnesses” & the tests “serve law enforcement purposes.” That judge was Brett Kavanaugh in 2016 case.

It was good to hear Dr. Ford’s explanation of why she decided to send the letter in and why she waited before going public: because she was afraid of being “personally annihilated.”  She went public after reporters came to her house.

At hearing. Re Chairman’s claims re FBI background checks: My experience has been that for a number of nominees they have withdrawn nominations or we have asked them to based solely on FBI check. FBI finds things out. The White House should let them do that here&finish their job
